test.name: test
test.description: Run all matching test files and print the results to stdout

flags.name: timeout
flags.description: Set the per-test timeout in milliseconds, default is 5000.

flags.name: rerun-each
flags.description: Re-run each test file <NUMBER> times, helps catch certain bugs

flags.name: only
flags.description: Only run tests that are marked with "test.only()"

flags.name: todo
flags.description: Include tests that are marked with "test.todo()"

flags.name: coverage-reporter
flags.description: Report coverage in 'text' and/or 'lcov'. Defaults to 'text'.

flags.name: coverage-dir
flags.description: Directory for coverage files. Defaults to 'coverage'.

flags.name: bail
flags.description: Exit the test suite after <NUMBER> failures. If you do not specify a number, it defaults to 1.

flags.name: test-name-pattern
flags.description: Run only tests with a name that matches the given regex.

flags.name: reporter
flags.description: Test output reporter format. Available: 'junit' (requires --reporter-outfile). Default: console output.

flags.name: reporter-outfile
flags.description: Output file path for the reporter format (required with --reporter).

x.name: x
x.description: Execute an npm package executable (CLI), automatically installing into a global shared cache if not installed in node_modules.

flags.name: bun
flags.description: Force the command to run with Bun instead of Node.js

x.usage: Usage: bunx [flags] <package><@version> [flags and arguments for the package]

exec.name: exec
exec.description: Execute a shell script directly from Bun.

install.name: install
install.description: Install the dependencies listed in package.json.

flags.name: no-save
flags.description: Don't update package.json or save a lockfile

flags.name: ca
flags.description: Provide a Certificate Authority signing certificate

flags.name: cafile
flags.description: The same as `--ca`, but is a file path to the certificate

flags.name: force
flags.description: Always request the latest versions from the registry & reinstall all dependencies

flags.name: cache-dir
flags.description: Store & load cached data from a specific directory path

flags.name: quiet
flags.description: Only show tarball name when packing

flags.name: no-verify
flags.description: Skip verifying integrity of newly downloaded packages

flags.name: ignore-scripts
flags.description: Skip lifecycle scripts in the project's package.json (dependency scripts are never run)

flags.name: trust
flags.description: Add to trustedDependencies in the project's package.json and install the package(s)

flags.name: backend
flags.description: Platform-specific optimizations for installing dependencies. Possible values: "clonefile" (default), "hardlink", "symlink", "copyfile"

flags.name: registry
flags.description: Use a specific registry by default, overriding .npmrc, bunfig.toml and environment variables

flags.name: concurrent-scripts
flags.description: Maximum number of concurrent jobs for lifecycle scripts (default 5)

flags.name: network-concurrency
flags.description: Maximum number of concurrent network requests (default 48)

flags.name: lockfile-only
flags.description: Generate a lockfile without installing dependencies

flags.name: exact
flags.description: Add the exact version instead of the ^range

flags.name: filter
flags.description: Install packages for the matching workspaces

flags.name: analyze
flags.description: Analyze & install all dependencies of files passed as arguments recursively (using Bun's bundler)

flags.name: only-missing
flags.description: Only add dependencies to package.json if they are not already present

add.name: add
add.description: Add a new dependency to package.json and install it.

flags.name: gzip-level

flags.description: The directory to put the patch file in (only if --commit is used)

pack.name: pack
pack.description: create a tarball of the current workspace

bin.name: bin
bin.description: print the path to bin folder

ls.name: ls
ls.description: list the dependency tree according to the current lockfile

why.name: why
why.description: <pkg>            show dependency tree explaining why a package is installed

view.name: view
view.description: name[@version]  view package metadata from the registry (use `bun info` instead)

version.name: version
version.description: [increment]  bump the version in package.json and create a git tag

hash.name: hash
hash.description: generate & print the hash of the current lockfile

hash-string.name: hash-string
hash-string.description: print the string used to hash the lockfile

hash-print.name: hash-print
hash-print.description: print the hash stored in the current lockfile

migrate.name: migrate
migrate.description: migrate another package manager's lockfile without installing anything

untrusted.name: untrusted
untrusted.description: print current untrusted dependencies with scripts

trust.name: trust
trust.description: names ...      run scripts for untrusted dependencies and add to `trustedDependencies`

default-trusted.name: default-trusted
default-trusted.description: print the default trusted dependencies list

info.name: info
info.description: View package metadata from the registry.

flags.name: backend

flags.name: registry
flags.description: Use a specific registry by default, overriding .npmrc, bunfig.toml and environment variables

flags.name: concurrent-scripts
flags.description: Maximum number of concurrent jobs for lifecycle scripts (default 5)

flags.name: network-concurrency
flags.description: Maximum number of concurrent network requests (default 48)

flags.name: lockfile-only
flags.description: Generate a lockfile without installing dependencies

build.name: build
build.description: Transpile and bundle one or more files.

flags.name: compile
flags.description: Generate a standalone Bun executable containing your bundled code. Implies --production

flags.name: watch
flags.description: Automatically restart the process on file change

flags.name: no-clear-screen
flags.description: Disable clearing the terminal screen on reload when --watch is enabled

flags.name: target
flags.description: The intended execution environment for the bundle. "browser", "bun" or "node"

flags.name: banner
flags.description: Add a banner to the bundled output such as "use client"; for a bundle being used with RSCs

flags.name: footer
flags.description: Add a footer to the bundled output such as // built with bun!

flags.name: format
flags.description: Specifies the module format to build to. "esm", "cjs" and "iife" are supported. Defaults to "esm".

flags.name: root
flags.description: Root directory used for multiple entry points

flags.name: public-path
flags.description: A prefix to be appended to any import paths in bundled code

flags.name: external
flags.description: Exclude module from transpilation (can use * wildcards). ex: -e react

flags.name: packages
flags.description: Add dependencies to bundle or keep them external. "external", "bundle" is supported. Defaults to "bundle".

flags.name: entry-naming
flags.description: Customize entry point filenames. Defaults to "[dir]/[name].[ext]"

flags.name: react-fast-refresh
flags.description: Enable React Fast Refresh transform (does not emit hot-module code, use this for testing)

flags.name: no-bundle
flags.description: Transpile file only, do not bundle

flags.name: emit-dce-annotations
flags.description: Re-emit DCE annotations in bundles. Enabled by default unless --minify-whitespace is passed.

flags.name: css-chunking
flags.description: Chunk CSS files together to reduce duplicated CSS loaded in a browser. Only has an effect when multiple entrypoints import CSS

flags.name: app
flags.description: (EXPERIMENTAL) Build a web app for production using Bun Bake.

flags.name: env
flags.description: Inline environment variables into the bundle as process.env.${name}. Defaults to 'disable'. To inline environment variables matching a prefix, use my prefix like 'FOO_PUBLIC_*'.

flags.name: windows-hide-console
flags.description: When using --compile targeting Windows, prevent a Command prompt from opening alongside the executable

flags.name: windows-icon
flags.description: When using --compile targeting Windows, assign an executable icon

flags.name: debug-dump-server-files
flags.description: When --app is set, dump all server files to disk even when building statically

flags.name: debug-no-minify
flags.description: When --app is set, do not minify anything

examples: Bundle code to be run in Bun (reduces server startup time)

init.name: init
init.description: Initialize a Bun project in the current directory.

globalFlags.name: watch
globalFlags.description: Automatically restart the process on file change

globalFlags.name: hot
globalFlags.description: Enable auto reload in the Bun runtime, test runner, or bundler

globalFlags.name: no-clear-screen
globalFlags.description: Disable clearing the terminal screen on reload when --hot or --watch is enabled

globalFlags.name: smol
globalFlags.description: Use less memory, but run garbage collection more often

globalFlags.name: preload
globalFlags.description: Import a module before other modules are loaded

globalFlags.name: require
globalFlags.description: Alias of --preload, for Node.js compatibility

globalFlags.name: import
globalFlags.description: Alias of --preload, for Node.js compatibility

globalFlags.name: inspect
globalFlags.description: Activate Bun's debugger

globalFlags.name: inspect-wait
globalFlags.description: Activate Bun's debugger, wait for a connection before executing

globalFlags.name: inspect-brk
globalFlags.description: Activate Bun's debugger, set breakpoint on first line of code and wait

globalFlags.name: if-present
globalFlags.description: Exit without an error if the entrypoint does not exist

globalFlags.name: no-install
globalFlags.description: Disable auto install in the Bun runtime

globalFlags.name: install
globalFlags.description: Configure auto-install behavior. One of "auto" (default, auto-installs when no node_modules), "fallback" (missing packages only), "force" (always).

globalFlags.name: i
globalFlags.description: Auto-install dependencies during execution. Equivalent to --install=fallback.

globalFlags.name: eval
globalFlags.description: Evaluate argument as a script

globalFlags.name: print
globalFlags.description: Evaluate argument as a script and print the result

globalFlags.name: prefer-offline
globalFlags.description: Skip staleness checks for packages in the Bun runtime and resolve from disk

globalFlags.name: prefer-latest
globalFlags.description: Use the latest matching versions of packages in the Bun runtime, always checking npm

globalFlags.name: port
globalFlags.description: Set the default port for Bun.serve

globalFlags.name: conditions
globalFlags.description: Pass custom conditions to resolve

globalFlags.name: fetch-preconnect
globalFlags.description: Preconnect to a URL while code is loading

globalFlags.name: max-http-header-size
globalFlags.description: Set the maximum size of HTTP headers in bytes. Default is 16KiB

globalFlags.name: dns-result-order
globalFlags.description: Set the default order of DNS lookup results. Valid orders: verbatim (default), ipv4first, ipv6first

globalFlags.name: expose-gc
globalFlags.description: Expose gc() on the global object. Has no effect on Bun.gc().

globalFlags.name: no-deprecation
globalFlags.description: Suppress all reporting of the custom deprecation.

globalFlags.name: throw-deprecation
globalFlags.description: Determine whether or not deprecation warnings result in errors.

globalFlags.name: title
globalFlags.description: Set the process title

globalFlags.name: zero-fill-buffers
globalFlags.description: Boolean to force Buffer.allocUnsafe(size) to be zero-filled.

globalFlags.name: redis-preconnect
globalFlags.description: Preconnect to $REDIS_URL at startup

globalFlags.name: sql-preconnect
globalFlags.description: Preconnect to PostgreSQL at startup

globalFlags.name: no-addons
globalFlags.description: Throw an error if process.dlopen is called, and disable export condition "node-addons"

globalFlags.name: unhandled-rejections
globalFlags.description: One of "strict", "throw", "warn", "none", or "warn-with-error-code"

globalFlags.name: console-depth
globalFlags.description: Set the default depth for console.log object inspection (default: 2)

globalFlags.name: silent
globalFlags.description: Don't print the script command

globalFlags.name: elide-lines
globalFlags.description: Number of lines of script output shown when using --filter (default: 10). Set to 0 to show all lines.

globalFlags.name: version
globalFlags.description: Print version and exit

globalFlags.name: revision
globalFlags.description: Print version with revision and exit

globalFlags.name: filter
globalFlags.description: Run a script in all workspace packages matching the pattern

globalFlags.name: bun
globalFlags.description: Force a script or package to use Bun's runtime instead of Node.js (via symlinking node)

globalFlags.name: shell
globalFlags.description: Control the shell used for package.json scripts. Supports either 'bun' or 'system'

globalFlags.name: env-file
globalFlags.description: Load environment variables from the specified file(s)

globalFlags.name: cwd
globalFlags.description: Absolute path to resolve files & entry points from. This just changes the process' cwd.

globalFlags.name: config
globalFlags.description: Specify path to Bun config file. Default $cwd/bunfig.toml

globalFlags.name: help
globalFlags.description: Display this menu and exit

bareCommand.description: Run JavaScript/TypeScript files directly or access package scripts and binaries
